member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.AbstractPipe`2
member.summary: An AbstractPipe provides most of the functionality that is repeated in every instance of a Pipe. Any subclass of AbstractPipe should simply implement MoveNext().
member.typeparam: The type of the consuming objects.
The type of the emitting objects.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.IPipe`2
member.summary: The generic interface for any Pipe implementation. A Pipe takes/consumes objects of type S and returns/emits objects of type E. S refers to starts and the E refers to ends.
member.typeparam: The type of the consuming objects.
The type of the emitting objects.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.CollectionFilterPipe`1
member.summary: A CollectionFilterPipe will take a collection of objects and a Filter.NOT_EQUAL or Filter.EQUAL argument. If an incoming object is contained (or not contained) in the provided collection, then it is emitted (or not emitted).
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.IFilterPipe`1
member.summary: A FilterPipe has no specified behavior save that it takes the same objects it emits. This interface is used to specify that a Pipe will either emit its input or not.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.IComparisonFilterPipe`2
member.summary: A ComparisonFilterPipe will allow or disallow objects that pass through it depending on some implemented comparison criteria.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.ExpandableEnumerator`1
member.summary: ExpandableEnumerator takes an IEnumerator and will emit its elements. However, if an object is added to ExpandableEnumerator, then its put into an internal queue. The queue has priority over the internal enumerator when accessing the current element.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.GroupCountPipe`1
member.summary: The GroupCountPipe will simply emit the incoming object, but generate a map side effect. The map's keys are the objects that come into the pipe. The map's values are the number of times that the key object has come into the pipe.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.Pipeline`2
member.summary: A Pipeline is a linear composite of Pipes. Pipeline takes a List of Pipes and joins them according to their order as specified by their location in the List. It is important to ensure that the provided ordered Pipes can connect together. That is, that the output of the n-1 Pipe is the same as the input to n Pipe. Once all provided Pipes are composed, a Pipeline can be treated like any other Pipe.
member.typeparam: The type of the consuming objects.
The type of the emitting objects.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.Pipeline`2.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a pipeline from the provided pipes.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.Pipeline`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{de.ahzf.Pipes.IPipe})
member.summary: Constructs a pipeline from the provided pipes. The ordered list determines how the pipes will be chained together. When the pipes are chained together, the start of pipe n is the end of pipe n-1.
member.param: The ordered list of pipes to chain together into a pipeline

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.Pipeline`2.#ctor(de.ahzf.Pipes.IPipe[])
member.summary: Constructs a pipeline from the provided pipes. The ordered array determines how the pipes will be chained together. When the pipes are chained together, the start of pipe n is the end of pipe n-1.
member.param: the ordered array of pipes to chain together into a pipeline

member.summary: Use when extending Pipeline and setting the pipeline chain without making use of the constructor.
member.param: the ordered list of pipes to chain together into a pipeline.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.AggregatorPipe`1
member.summary: The AggregatorPipe produces a side effect that is the provided Collection filled with the contents of all the objects that have passed through it. Before the first object is emitted from the AggregatorPipe, all of its incoming objects have been aggregated into the collection. The collection enumerator is used as the emitting enumerator. Thus, what goes into AggregatorPipe may not be the same as what comes out of AggregatorPipe. For example, duplicates removed, different order to the stream, etc. Finally, note that different Collections have different behaviors and write/read times.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.AggregatorPipe`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new AggregatorPipe.

member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: P:de.ahzf.Pipes.AggregatorPipe`1.SideEffect
member.summary: The sideeffect produced by this pipe.

member.summary: The ToUpperPipe converts all incoming strings to uppercase.

member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.RandomFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The RandomFilterPipe filters out objects that pass through it using a biased coin. For each passing object, a random number generator creates a double value between 0 and 1. If the randomly generated double is less than or equal the provided bias, then the object is allowed to pass. If the randomly generated double is greater than the provided bias, then the object is not allowed to pass.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.RandomFilterPipe`1.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new RandomFilterPipe.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.RandomFilterPipe`1.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.RandomFilterPipe`1.ToString
member.summary: A string representation of this pipe.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.DuplicateFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The DuplicateFilterPipe will not allow a duplicate object to pass through it. This is accomplished by the Pipe maintaining an internal HashSet that is used to store a history of previously seen objects. Thus, the more unique objects that pass through this Pipe, the slower it becomes as a log_2 index is checked for every object.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.DuplicateFilterPipe`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new DuplicateFilterPipe.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.DuplicateFilterPipe`1.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.OrFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The OrFilterPipe takes a collection of pipes that emit boolean objects. Each pipe in the collection is fed the same incoming S object. If one of the internal pipes emits true, then the OrFilterPipe emits the S object. If not, then the incoming object is not emitted.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.UniquePathFilterPipe`1
member.summary: UniquePathFilterPipe will only let an object pass if the path up to this point has no repeated elements. Thus, its a way to filter out paths that are looping.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.UniquePathFilterPipe`1.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.AndFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The AndFilterPipe takes a collection of pipes, where E is boolean. Each provided pipe is fed the same incoming S object. If all the pipes emit true, then the AndFilterPipe emits the incoming S object. If not, then the incoming S object is not emitted.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.AndFilterPipe`1.#ctor(de.ahzf.Pipes.IPipe{`0,System.Boolean}[])
member.summary: Creates a new pipe based on the given pipes.

member.summary: Creates a new pipe based on the given pipes.

member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.FutureFilterPipe`1
member.summary: FutureFilterPipe will allow an object to pass through it if the object has an output from the pipe provided in the constructor of the FutureFilterPipe.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.ObjectFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The ObjectFilterPipe will either allow or disallow all objects that pass through it depending on the result of the compareObject() method.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.AbstractComparisonFilterPipe`2
member.summary: The AbstractComparisonFilterPipe provides the necessary functionality that is required of most ComparisonFilterPipe implementations. The compareObjects() implementation is useful for comparing two objects to determine if the current object in the pipe should be filtered. Depending on the type of ComparisonFilterPipe.Filter used, different types of comparisons are evaluated.

member.name: F:de.ahzf.Pipes.AbstractComparisonFilterPipe`2._Filter
member.summary: The filter used for comparing two objects.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.AbstractComparisonFilterPipe`2.#ctor(de.ahzf.Pipes.ComparisonFilter)
member.summary: Creates a new AbstractComparisonFilterPipe using the given filter.
member.param: The filter used for comparing two objects.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.AbstractComparisonFilterPipe`2.CompareObjects(`1,`1)
member.summary: Compares two objects.
member.returns: A match based on the defined filter.

member.summary: A string representation of this filter pipe.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.RangeFilterPipe`1
member.summary: The RangeFilterPipe will only allow a sequential subset of its incoming objects to be emitted to its output. This pipe can be provided -1 for both its high and low range to denote a wildcard for high and/or low. Note that -1 for both high and low is equivalent to the IdentityPipe.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements within the filter.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.RangeFilterPipe`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new RangeFilterPipe.

member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.summary: A string representation of this pipe.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.PathPipe`1
member.summary: Emits the path that the traverser has taken up to this object. In other words, it uses the Path property of the previous pipe to emit the transformation stages.
member.typeparam: The type of the consuming objects.

member.name: M:de.ahzf.Pipes.PathPipe`1.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.ScatterPipe`2
member.summary: ScatterPipe will unroll any IEnumerator/IEnumerable that is inputted into it. This will only occur for one level deep. It will not unroll an IEnumerator emitted by an IEnumerator, etc.
member.typeparam: The type of the consuming objects.
The type of the emitting objects.

member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: T:de.ahzf.Pipes.MultiEnumerator`1
member.summary: A MultiEnumerator takes multiple IEnumerators in its constructor and makes them behave like a single enumerator. The order in which objects are returned from both enumerators are with respect to the order of the enumerators passed into the constructor.
